swim.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs
swim.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: kids learning to swim the backstroke
She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
We swam in the chilly water.
She could swim across the lake.
swim.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: when fish, ducks etc swim, they move around the water using their tails and fins, their feet etc
swim.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Tropical fish swam slowly around in the tank.
swim.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if your head swims, you start to feel confused or that everything is spinning around
swim.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: My head was swimming after looking at that screen all day.
swim.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if something you are looking at swims, it seems to be moving around, usually because you are ill, tired, or drunk
swim.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The numbers swam before my eyes.
swim.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a period of time that you spend swimming
